attributes.comment:
I would like to comment on the proposed fee increase for N-400 Application for
Naturalization. Becoming an American citizen is something every immigrant wishes
for and after being here in the country legally for several years and going
through all
necessary wait time and paying taxes, its discouraging to see that USCIS
proposes a massive increase in filing fees.

1--> As a percentage of income, the increase in fees will likely hit hard on
people who can afford the least.
2--> Since the cost of becoming a citizen increases, immigrants will be less
likely to get involved in local elections and communities since they cannot vote.
3--> Also, immigrants likely miss out on rendering their exceptional service to
state and federal govt, since government jobs require most applicants to be
citizens..
4--> On the long run, citizens of US will likely play greater role in advancing
its interest elsewhere in the world so a less than painful process for
immigrants would benefit everyone.

Sincerely.
Praveen
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Praveen Panati
